meanings.definition: An act of supporting the body in a vertical position by balancing on the hands.
meanings.sent1: During recess, the kids showed off their impressive handstands on the playground.
meanings.sent2: Gymnasts often practice handstands to improve their balance and strength.
meanings.sent3: The clown attempted a handstand but ended up tumbling over in a comical fashion.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence soared as she held a perfect handstand, feeling like she could conquer the world.
meanings.sent5: The handstand competition at the talent show left the audience in awe of the performers' skills.

meanings.sent1: She loves to handstand against the wall to practice her form.
meanings.sent2: The gymnast will handstand on the balance beam during her routine.
meanings.sent3: He decided to handstand in the park, much to the surprise of the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: In moments of joy, she would handstand in celebration of her achievements.
meanings.sent5: The daredevil handstands on the edge of the cliff left spectators gasping in fear.
